title: [SOLVED]820-3476 PPBUS low no power
message: no liquide damage, just customer used magsafe 45W, no power from charger and battery PP3V42_G3h present 3.41V and ppbus_g3h 0.6V tried magsafe 60w same pb already checked U7100 pin 17/18 and 27/28, smc_bc_acok 3.3v

title: [SOLVED]820-3476 PPBUS low no power
message: Resistance to GND on PPBUS_G3H?? Voltage on PPBUS_G3H??

title: [SOLVED]820-3476 PPBUS low no power
message: PPBUS_G3H 0.6V resistance to gnd on PPBUS_G3H and [B]PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_REG short to gnd 0 ohm short to gnd CHGR_CSO_R_N, CHGR_CSO_P_N[/B]

title: [SOLVED]820-3476 PPBUS low no power
message: I don't understand what you are saying about [B]CHGR_CSO_R_N, CHGR_CSO_P_N, [/B]but if there is a 0 ohm short to ground on F7140, time to remove F7140 and see which side the short circuit is on. If it is on pin 2, something is wrong with the system side, if it is on pin 1, something is wrong with the ISL6259 side. If the issue is on the system side I would begin by checking resistance between pin 2 of F7140 and the CPU coils, PP3V3_S5 coils, PP5V_S4 coil, and so on, and if no short is present there then inject 1v to see what gets hot and find the short.

title: [SOLVED]820-3476 PPBUS low no power
message:
short on pin 2 of F7140

51 ohm cpu coils to pin 2 of F7140

3.75 kohms PP3V3_S5 coils to pin 2 F7140

PP5V_S5 30k ohms coil to pin 2 of F7140

inject 1v to pin 2 of F7140 nothing hot

title: [SOLVED]820-3476 PPBUS low no power
message: Inject voltage and monitor current. At 2 amps something must get hot. This bus is normally 12V so you can go a lot higher.

title: [SOLVED]820-3476 PPBUS low no power
message:
yes find bad capacitor C7582 now another problem PP3V42_G3H 2.5V and no green/orange light, Q7010 very hot, replaced and always hot

no short to gnd pin of Q7010

title: [SOLVED]820-3476 PPBUS low no power
message:
I don't get your logic. You say this was not water damaged so why check U6100?

If this really "just" happened it would have been because of a garbage Chinese charger and 3V42 spiking or something. An issue with PPVRTC/clock chip is more likely then.

title: [SOLVED]820-3476 PPBUS low no power
message: Ppvrtc_g3h 3.3v

title: [SOLVED]820-3476 PPBUS low no power
message: Where did I say CPU Vcore is never shorted? It is common to have a low value of 2 Ohms there and that is then mistaken for a short.

title: [SOLVED]820-3476 PPBUS low no power
message:
SMC_ADAPTER_EN only will go high if the correct or higher wattage charger is connected. So this board works now?

I hope you bought a 85W charger as this is the only one you need for testing.
